dailysoundtracks.description: Huge fan of St. Vincent in general but this album is my favourite. It's super 70s and I love the vibe and lyrics of this song a lot.

dailysoundtracks.album: Everything That Happens Will Happen Today
dailysoundtracks.description: It's a kind of haunting song and it's really stuck with me for a long time. David Byrne just has something special about him.

dailysoundtracks.album: Pokemon Mystery Dungeon: Blue Rescue Team
dailysoundtracks.description: Wow! This music is so unlike other Pokemon music and just so groovy. Perfect for the final level of this great game.
Epic, symphonic 7 minute banger from Spellling. It's about being 16 and complaining about the boys at school.... and also so much more than that. The whole album is amazing.
Noisy wall of sound from this great band. Big vibes. Love this track.
This is a song for gazing out the window to. A song for re-evaluating your life choices.

dailysoundtracks.album: Animal Crossing: Let's Go To The City
dailysoundtracks.description: An official club remix of the best K.K. Song from the composer and K.K. Slider himself, Totaka
Insane how gorgeous this track is. It's because all three pilotwings games have 10/10 soundtracks and unmatchable vibes.
Who'd have thought that motherfucking Sydney Sprint would end up being my favourite Mario Kart music from this game. The saxophone goes so crazy and I am obsessed.
Super intense track from the original DKC. I've always loved this game's special vibe and it's all thanks to this music.
This song represents that New York ballroom vibe the best from Madonna's Vogue era. It's so great and I love the video too. There's a flamenco breakdown!

One of my all-time favourites. I remember seeing it on top of the pops live on the TV and thinking it was the best thing ever. I had to go have a bath because I was literally 8, but I made Mum promise to tell me if she comes back on the TV again so I could watch it.

dailysoundtracks.track: Molgera (The Legend of Zelda: The Wind Waker)
dailysoundtracks.description: I know the original is great but there's something about the strings in this smash remix which just gets me going. It's intense enough as it is and then it loops and reharmonises the original making it even more intense. I'm obsessed.
Crazy, symphonic SNES soundtrack which goes so much harder than it needs to. The whole first minute is just the intro! Then it loops in this crazy Mozart-ass psychedelic section.
Great disco album from the disco queen. I love the part with 'rosebud'
Hands-down the best music to come out of the NES. I mean, compare this to the fucking super mario theme.
This song is so nostalgic it's crazy! It's genuinely a great track. It was everywhere in the UK in the 00s.

dailysoundtracks.album: Spider-Man and the X-Men in Arcade's Revenge
dailysoundtracks.description: Hello why is this the craziest SNES music to exist ever? Well it turns out the composer is a hidden legend and a technical wizard. Anyway I can't write anything else because I'm currently transcending listening to this music.
What a dark and creepy vibe for a boss fight! Melancholic music for a melancholic game.
Huge disco track that I have DJ'd many times. I am obsessed with the music video though. The outfits, the close ups, the guy (he's hot), the animals, is there a storyline?
This is THE karaoke song. It's a classic. But I especially love the video how she is a total bitch.
An all time classic. I have a memory of someone challenging me to play this on the piano and I didn't know it so I listened and fell in love. Also the Mario Kart World remix is 10/10

Always loved this song because it's so danceable! Looking back now I realise that this was some rare gay representation when I was growing up. I used to think and honestly still do think that the singer looks so hot in the video. Also, great video.
Great chill track from this genuine banger of a soundtrack. The whole OST is great honestly.
Personal little thing, maybe not for everyone but I always loved it. I have listened to this so much.
Banger track that still goes so hard. I think it was a global hit so you can always break this out at Karaoke. They call me Stacy! THAT'S NOT MY NAME!!

dailysoundtracks.album: The Legend of Zelda: Skyward Sword
dailysoundtracks.description: This music is such a vibe. They really nailed the feeling of an ocean-turned-desert with this one. Love the chord progression.
The breakout hit from this band that I loved as a young gay boy. I think this remains their best track.
Love loads of Jamiroquai classic tracks but this is maybe a little less known and is actually a huge banger. There's this part at the end that I love when the strings come in.
A song about discovering your husband has a pussy palace and is a sex addict. I love songs with very concrete themes and this one is just great and catchy too. Shoutouts to Lily Allen she's great.
I'm in it for the chord progression and the minimal Animal Crossing instrumentation. Just trust me it's great.
Great band and great music videos always. I would love to direct and make a music video like this one day.
Sad song. Love the ending. Great album
Great psych rock track from an early Tame Impala album, always find myself coming back to this.
Beautiful music for when you meet your sister in the game. My upstairs neighbour plays this on the piano and I bonded with her about that.
Old song that I loved as a teenager and coming back to it now I realise it's still great. It's got this amazing build up towards the end.
A legendary composer of funky video game music made the soundtrack to a childhood game of mine, Gex! It's so good. This one is from the spaghetti western level.
So many huge tracks from this soundtrack but today I'm serving you their disco banger from the beach level. Would love to DJ this but I feel like it's too much.
Huge hit from a huge (okay very underrated) game.
I heard this song from an advert way back when and actually I love it. Video is great too. The lyrics do not make sense.
Great track from an underrated band featuring a cool spaghetti western break in the middle. Whole album is worth a listen!
The first level from this classic game. It's beautiful.
I love her so much. She really came out with 3 sci-fi concept albums before becoming a megastar. This is her super ambitious debut, it's so good.
This band released an album that's not on streaming! I have the CD. This song is great, it's super funny and features Little Simz!
I was obsessed with this song when it came out and honestly I still am. The video is also great. This band is a heavy inspiration for my website
I love the second verse in this bop. She is amazing
I love Fleet Foxes!! Here is a hidden gem for you, a cover of a very old song from Joan Baez all about telling a man to fuck off.

dailysoundtracks.album: The Legend of Zelda: Majora's Mask
dailysoundtracks.description: Picture me at the piano wearing a long robe playing this over and over. I love it
I love this soundtrack so much! This is one of my favourite tracks from it. What makes it special is its chord sequence!
The credits theme from an obscure old visual novel. Great vibes.
Beautiful music from arguably the best Pokemon soundtrack. I love the harmony. It feels like music to ascend to heaven to.

dailysoundtracks.artist: Masami Ueda, Hiroshi Yamaguchi, Rei Kondoh, Akari Kaida
dailysoundtracks.description: This music plays after you purify an area and I love it. This soundtrack has traditional Japanese instruments everywhere and is super ethereal and unlike anything else really.

I heard a song from this guy on an advert and looked up what it was and found this album. On this album, this one track is particularly nice and I've often come back to it. It kinda reminds me of 'Hana Valley' from Okami.
One of the best ever karaoke songs. I love it. Catch me at Monster Ronson's on a monday belting this out.

Kendrick sampled this band in 'Bitch don't kill my vibe', but I learned that after my deep dive into scandinavian indie music back in like 2010. This is the final track from their first album. I've always loved it even though to this day I've never looked up the translation of the lyrics. It's a cover of some Danish artists called Skousen and Ingemann.
Learned about this group because Kendrick sampled this song on Section 80. They have one album and it's fucking great.

dailysoundtracks.album: Lesley Step Lightly: The Gm Recordings Plus 1974-1982
dailysoundtracks.description: Found this thanks to a cover by Melody Gardot. It's beautiful and rare.
This soundtrack just like many N64 and PS1 games of this era had this awesome house/jungle vibe. This track is one of my faves from this game I used to play as a child.
The unofficial main theme of Smash 64 and huge source of nostalgia for me. It takes me right back to beating classic mode with every character as a child in front of our TV.
I love how she never sings about sex and relationships. Her songs about so many random things. This one is about new year and even features a countdown!

dailysoundtracks.artist: Naoko Mitome, Masanobu Matsunaga, Yasuhisa Baba, Kenichi Nishimaki
dailysoundtracks.description: I just love this remix of the Balloon Fight music. It's so Nintendo Wii, and makes me just want to smile for photos while holding some juice and playing tennis and shaking hands.
One of the stages in this kooky game has this music instead of the normal music and it's such a vibe. They put a whole-ass song on the GBA with switching styles and everything. I've always loved it.
I always loved this track at the end of this iconic album. It's dirty and seedy and dramatic. Who is Penelope? I bet she's up to no good.

This soundtrack is so fucking good and so nostalgic that I made a whole mix of it (available for download on this website) and have regularly listened to it in the gym. I have a secret youtube channel called Darkmooncaverns19 inspired by how good this music is.
Together with their hit Last Christmas, Wham! release 'Everything She Wants', a song with (in my opinion) questionable lyrics complaining
This is the best Christmas song and you cannot convince me otherwise.
A local band I loved growing up. This is one of my favourite songs from them, all about unplugging yourself and touching grass.
I've been a fan forever and this was the first song of hers that I heard. This is a lovely recent performance with a live orchestra. What can I say I'm just a fan and I love her.

dailysoundtracks.album: Donkey Kong Country 2: Diddy's Kong Quest
dailysoundtracks.description: When you make a game about monkeys going through the jungle you don't expect the composer to make the biggest vibes ever and some of the most iconic video game music of all time and yet here we are. Catch me listening to Stickerbush Symphony on the bus, at work, at parties and events. It's timeless.

There are a thousand 10/10 tracks to pick from on this soundtrack but I want to highlight the credits music. There's this smooth saxophone part a couple of minutes in that I love so much. They brought back David Wise one time for this soundtrack and that's why it's legendary. At the tail end there is a remix of Stickerbush Symphony. So good.
Huge banger from one of the best soundtracks ever. I literally DJ'd this track as is once because it's that good. This whole soundtrack is house bangers and I'm obsessed.

dailysoundtracks.album: Super Smash Bros for Wii U
dailysoundtracks.description: Hearing this for the first time was what made me drop everything and deep dive into everything Earthbound related. It also kickstarted my first ever video game mix back in 2014. Yoko Shimamura has gone on to become one of my favourite VGM composers.

I love this band and when I heard the first notes for the first time I immediately fell in love with this new direction they took. It sounds like Sega Genesis music! And those synth solos over those chord sequences are just amazing. Also the lyrics are so real.
The best song from Undertale. A huge track. Having explored all the previous areas with very peaceful music, this kinda of urgent disco music is such a contrast.
A noticeable shift in vibe from previous installments in this series. Gorgeous track for a serious, haunting location
A rare indie game from
The album that this song comes from has such a special silky smooth vibe, everything reverberated and spacey. I really like this song in particular for its big climax at the end.

dailysoundtracks.track: You're Gonna Make Me Lonesome When You Go
dailysoundtracks.description: Lovely track that my mum likes. My favourite part is the second verse when this warm synth comes in. It gives me goosebumps.

This is taken from a orchestrated remix album of tracks from the original Mother on the NES. It's wild that it exists, but it's ultimately the reason why composer Shogo Sakai went on to arrange songs like Pollyanna and Bein' Friends in Super Smash Bros Melee. This album is why those tracks are so iconic. Anyway, this track is a deep cut from that album but is randomly so gorgeous. I come back to it a lot.
It's hard to pin down what genre this music is but it's so chill and beautiful. I love this track.
Some legendary Japanese electronic music! Super fun chords and synths. It sounds like video games!
Beautiful song that I've enjoyed for years and years. This song got me into Patrick Watson way back when.
Beautiful piano track from the original Hollow Knight. Stunning and easy to learn on the piano!
I'm embarrassed to talk about Muse nowadays but when I was younger I was listening to them! This track is such great rock music.
I saw this artist at a music festival many years ago and bought the CD. The final track is the one that stayed with me this whole time.
A nice low-key, kinda ominous track from this band I really like. It features Lykke Li who I also really like.

dailysoundtracks.artist: Yasuhisa Baba, Chika Sekigawa, & Naoko Mitome
dailysoundtracks.description: I love this soundtrack so much. This is a super mellow track considering it's played in a cave full of mind-controlling flower people.

Underrated banger from a very easy boss in Mario Galaxy. In the game, you beat the boss before you hear the whole track, but that didn't stop the team at Mario Kart World remixing it, and it's sooooo gooooood!

dailysoundtracks.track: I Never Thought I'd See The Day
dailysoundtracks.description: A song for when you are on your own and feeling emotional. Music for gazing at the moon to. Maybe music for when something really bad has just happened.
One of the very few German-language songs I tolerate! A banger!

Please take a moment to enjoy this music video! This artist is wild and I am a huge fan. A quote from a commenter: 'she's like a witch who has spent an inordinate number of lifetimes studying the arcane arts and has forgotten what it's like to be human but woke up in a very good mood today'
Bossa nova bliss! No video game has nailed beach music as well as this. It's divine, and it's perfect.

dailysoundtracks.album: And In The Darkness, Hearts Aglow
dailysoundtracks.track: God Turn Me Into a Flower
dailysoundtracks.description: Beautiful, stunning song. Music reserved for when I'm feeling lost, devastated, wistful, broken after a major life change. The video makes me feel a lot of things.

dailysoundtracks.artist: Manaka Kataoka, Maasa Miyoshi, Masato Ohashi, Tsukasa Usui
dailysoundtracks.album: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom
dailysoundtracks.description: So much to love from this soundtrack, but this is my favourite. It's sparse but still has a lot going on. So pleasant to listen to
I love Norah Jones! This song however is very different from your normal Norah programming. It's a song about murdering Miriam

An English band I've followed since forever, I've enjoyed their folky music from all their albums. This is a deep cut which I love for its chill vibes. Feels like I'm at a pub hanging out with the band

I love Pikmin and this is the best music from all the games. It's a never-heard-before chord sequence over a dreamy 5/4 time signature experience. Close your eyes and enjoy the visuals as you listen to this track

Today's obscure-ass video game music comes from much-hated Fire Emblem Fates, a game that I love. It's from the later maps of the not-very-good Revelations route and it is so creepy and nice. A healthy 7/8 time signature helps too.
I'm a diehard fan of this guy and I will recommend many songs from him but here's a newer one which touched me. Nice video too
I love Michael Kiwanuka's albums but one of my favourite tracks (and videos!) is this special single track. It's rare! Take a moment to appreciate the video today, it's gorgeous.
Little Simz is so cool! She's my favourite rapper, and this video is great.
This soundtrack didn't have all that much to offer, but I loved this remix of Super Metroid's Lower Brinstar. It's peaceful but unsettling

I can't remember how I got into this album but it's a recreation (or maybe entirely new tracks?) for the old Kojima game Policenauts. I originally heard it in a Sheik combo video. It's full of Jazz fusion bangers!

When I first heard this track, I was transfixed. I sank into a deep obsession with this band and came to love this album and all their subsequent releases. What gender is the singer? Who knows. I don't know about the video but the music just hits so hard.
I just want it to be on record that this is my favourite hourly theme from Animal Crossing. I have many favourites but I think this is my true favourite.

dailysoundtracks.track: É Preciso Dar um Jeito, Meu Amigo
dailysoundtracks.description: A groovy Brazilian rock song that kickstarted a lengthy journey into Brazilian music for me!
I love this band! They're local and based in Berlin and we saw them once and it was amazing. This track is giving lesbians in a spa vibes. The video is kinda uncomfortable though
Everyone talks about the Wii Shop Channel but nobody mentions the wealth of banger music they had on rotation for the Wii U and 3DS. This one is a personal favourite of mine.
I love this groovy track from the Nintendo DS. It's so catchy and fun.
Huge track from this great band. I love their classic house inspired pop. I've DJ'd this track many times. Also I'm obsessed with the singer she is so beautiful

dailysoundtracks.album: The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time
dailysoundtracks.description: A classic, ambient track from Ocarina of Time. It's unlikely that games have music like this in them. It's eerie and beautiful and I love it.
At the 1998 Grammys, Pavarotti was meant to come and sing his Nessum Dorma, but had a sore throat, so his mate Aretha jumps in for him and well, you just have to watch it for yourself.
I love Sade with all my heart. This song is about a man who killed someone at war, and how he wears his shame like a tattoo. It's devastating
A beautiful track that I used to love and adore. I just discovered this concert with her and an orchestra. It's gorgeous!
I really enjoy this groovy disco pop song. There's this one chord progression where he says 'start talking to people we don't even know' which makes me go OOH every time.

So difficult to select a track from this soundtrack because there are so many incredible ones. Here's a taste for the uninitiated: one of the battle songs! It's tango music with a bossa nova bit, and they called it mariachi. In the game you have to hit your opponents to the beat of the music, so the battle music was always a big deal.

The Melee remix of Kraid's Lair from Metroid goes so hard. I think this track alone turned on many hapless smash fans onto the majesty that is Metroid music. Taking the original NES bleeps and bloops and turning it into this, incredible. I love the beat drop halfway through.

Here's a gem from the Woolly World soundtrack. It plays in an auto-scroll level right before the final boss. You don't even get to hear the whole track during the level! But it's so hypnotic and beautiful and unlike any other kind of Bowser's Castle song.

The only video available is this Italian lady introducing the song but you can enjoy that! This song is kinda wild and I guess not for everyone but I love it. In the song, she is comparing her pussy to a volcano.

She is so cool and I love her style. She look so cute and beautiful in this music video. She produces her own music! It's all got this super cool breakbeat style and she's just giving popular girl at school vibes on top of it.
Happy halloween! Here's a spooky track that I love, the remix of Boo Lake from the DLC tracks of Mario Kart 8. Those drums are insane.
A super intense track from the Celeste's Farewell soundtrack. This was that part of the game with the blocks flicking in and out. I just really like it

There's more to this song than meets the eye. It's message: stay with your man even though it's bad! When I see the clip of her running in fear, it's giving domestic abuse. What's really going on, Kylie?
This song and video is extra, I love it. Shoutouts to Spellling for serving witchy magic music. It's so dramatic and I love her voice.
Beautiful song with an interesting structure that means a lot to me. This song was there for me when I was feeling feelings for a certain Mexican.
Beautiful track from a band I love. This version has added strings and trumpets which melts me. It's very Scandinavian
This song and video is everything. This band also made a website which inspired this one. I just want to be like her.
I listened to this music a lot because I completed all 50 levels. At first I hated it but now I love it. I feel very strongly towards it.
Insanely beautiful first level music from this 10/10 puzzle indie game. This is the music that got me to buy the game. It's just a taste of what awaits you when you also buy the game.
Classic track from my childhood. 'Lie down on the couch' is still something I say, also 'That boy needs therapy'. Video is fantastic too
Awesome cover of an obscure Depeche Mode song on this Norwegian TV show. I love it and I think Susanne Sundfør is great.
A beautiful and bewitching follow-up to 'City of Tears' with a stunning chord progression. Love it
The most outrageous bossa nova remix from the Mario Kart World team reimagining this classic from the DS era. I love the reharmonisation.
A beautiful song that I carry with me. It's about her, the moon, reflecting the light of her sun.
This is a wild track from a band who previous did bubblegum pop music. I love it. They said they wanted the song to be 'un-playlist-able' which it most definitely is.

dailysoundtracks.artist: Arata Iiyoshi, Keisuke Ito, Hideki Sakamoto
dailysoundtracks.album: Pokemon Mystery Dungeon: Explorers of Sky
dailysoundtracks.description: Huge vibe from this classic Pokemon game. Love the drums.
A song she did for a film 'Young Americans'. It's so dramatic and good. It should be the theme of a James Bond film.

One of my favourite ever songs. It's about Jens pretending to be the boyfriend of his friend Nina, who is using him to cover up her lesbian relationship. It's hilarious and lovely. And it has a follow-up! Check out 'the linden trees are still in blossom'

Expect a lot of Mario Kart World recommendations folks because this soundtrack is out of control. This is a remix of a pretty forgettable track from the Wii U but they made it slap so hard! Also, it's a rare track: it doesn't play on free roam, only on transitions between lava levels.
A beautiful track about documenting lovely moments. Stunning video as well!

dailysoundtracks.album: Paper Mario: The Thousand Year Door
dailysoundtracks.description: Today I'm celebrating this game's release on the Nintendo Music App with this absolute banger from the Gamecube. It's one of Nintendo's only dance bangers and who knows maybe it will find itself in a DJ World Peace set one day.

Welcome to the first soundtrack of the day! I'll use this space to recommend you some great music to enjoy every single day! Today I wanna highlight one of my all-time favourite artists Natalia and this song all about fucking off because she's had enough. Say no to screens, likes, annoying real-life shit and just go to the beach, get naked and swim in the sea and chat with the moon. The sigh right before the porrito reveal says it all.
